page.title: 03WEAVERS, KINGSTON ST.MARY
page.content: The traditional arts and crafts practised at Church Farm are those handed down from generation to generation. Certainly the weavers we interviewed have had more than the average six months to learn their hobby-cum-job. The man we interviewed started to learn to weave when he was about seven, although he confesses that he is more of a potter than a weaver. The business as well as being used by tourists has also been commissioned by the Society of Friends to make a backcloth similar to the Bayeux Tapestry depicting the history of the Quaker Movement. The cloth is all hand-made from the spinning of the fleece to the weaving of the cloth. All dyes used are natural and many are grown by them. Cloth costs from nine to twelve pounds per square yard.
